title: Champions That Need VGUs
body:
Obviously this is opinionated. They are in order.

Full VGU:

1. Dr. Mundo
2. Shaco
3. Tryndamere
4. Amumu
5. Fiddlesticks
6. Volibear
7. Vi
8. Pantheon
9. Nocturne
10. Master Yi
11. Karthus
12. Udyr
13. Illaoi - this one was tuff between full and minor, but I think to keep her tactical mechanic the rest of her kit needs an extreme overhaul.

Minor VGU:

1. Diana and Leona
2. Malphite
3. Hecarim
4. Nasus
5. Nautilus 
6. Rek'Sai
7. Shyvana
8. Wukong
9. Renekton
10. Skarner
11. Quinn
12. Ryze
13. Shen
14. Zilean

Let me know yours or tell me I'm wrong. I would love to have a good discussion. Excluded Morde because he is supposed to get one in 2019.

You picked champions who are modernized or have already have extensive work done to them. They're not going to rework or VGU champions that are already in stable places.

This is about who needs work done. A champion kit being newer does not make it inherently better. Some of the more recently updated champions like Shaco which you agreed with needs a full VGU even though he was updated in the Assassin Update. Vi is this fighter that is supposed to get into the thick of things yet she has to build full damage to try to assassinate 1 target. If she can not do so she is utterly useless. She does not offer enough CC or take enough hits when building tank to justify building tankier unless you are unable to one shot and then you are an ult bot.

Illaoi is not about how hard she is to face which she isn't. It is that she does not fit any role and can not do any job well enough. She needs a way to kill turrets faster to be a scary split push champion or she needs better ways to deal consistent damage in teamfights.

Malphite I believe could be fixed with minor changes. Like a larger delay on his ultimate to free up more power to be added to the rest of his kit. Maybe a new Q and the just number changes and scaling changes after that. But he could aslo just get a full VGU.

Hecarim is one of the worst feast or famine champions in the game. He should get an update soon because he has been relatively neglected.

Having to build a grevious wounds item and qss to fight Nasus is not ok. He needs a new passive, and either a new E or a new W. 2012 was almost 7 years ago.

Rek' Sai is one of Riots greatest failed releases up there with Ivern. She needs tremor sense removed or a complete overhaul. That champion can't be balanced with free information early and a super strong early game kit. It is as oppressive as Nidalee in her prime.

Renekton needs some kit modernization. He is one of the most binary champions left.

Since when is Quinn a top tier VGU champion? When didRiot say this? All champions are functional, that is not my issue with any champion. It is how they interact with the current champion roster and the game in general. Quinn just needs some way to feel better to play as and against since no one likes facing her she is in this state that also isn't much fun to play anymore.

How to start fixing Ryze: Remove the point and click, ranged, hard CC, that is on a basic ability. Then fix from there.

Also being in a stable place does not mean it is healthy.

>Illaoi is not about how hard she is to face which she isn't. It is that she does not fit any role and can not do any job well enough. She needs a way to kill turrets faster to be a scary split push champion or she needs better ways to deal consistent damage in teamfights.

Binary champions are fine if it's something like Blitz (Land Q and you're a god, miss and you're useless).
The problem comes with champions like Trynd.
If you can open a gap after his W and first E, he can't hit you to reset his E CD, so he can't kill you and is useless.
If you can't do that, he'll just run you down with little you can do about it.

Illaoi being a pubstomper is fine. Her issue is that's **all** she does.
Illaoi has a respectable skill ceiling, but even if she plays well the honess is on her opponent as to whether or not they win the lane.
If they understand the matchup and execute properly, Illaoi loses.
If they run in dick first with their jungler into an Illaoi ult, Illaoi crushes.

i think illaoi isnt hard to do.

**step 1:** make her tentacles not targetable from outside direct vision anymore. 

if the enemy doesnt have direct vision on the tentacles, the red oracles shadows or simply having them visible without being targetable is enough to communicate that theyre around.

back when riot changed the tentacles to not be hidden in bushes anymore, their reasoning was that it was too hard to gage illaois power without knowing where her tentacles are. but this never justified making them also targetable by attacks from outside vision.

that means no more attacking tentacles from outside of bushes. this means ranged champions have to walk up to them just as melee champions to to take them out. or they have to sacrifice a ward.

this would close the gap in power between ranged and melee matchups against her, and ranged champions wouldnt have a disproportionate advantage.

**step 2:** instead of her passive having a cooldown when a tentacle can be placed, the cooldown is on the **wall** instead, similar to how talons e puts walls on cooldown.

this would accomplish two things. for one, she doesnt have to wait for 30 seconds to be able to put up tentacles whenever she moves around the map between lanes into a new area during the teamfight phase. she could just immediately set up a couple tentacles around walls that are nearby since they will all be off cooldown.

secondly, when laning against illaoi youre a bit more rewarded for removing single tentacles. she cant just immediately replace them on the spot youve just taken one out, because she happened to sit on the cooldown, and it doesnt feel like youre pissing against the wind at times. it just makes it generally a bit better to play around the tentacles. you remove one, and the wall is now on a 20 to 10 second cooldown and you created an opening to move up and grab a couple cs or trade into her.

Vi needs it bad. Camille just does her job better in every way. Vi is required to build practically full damage and if she doesn't one shot she is useless because she does instantly herself and has long cooldowns. Vi does not fit her fantasy at all. She is out dated and needs a full VGU. Karthus is much more arguable for just a small VGU.

That's less an issue with Vi than Camille. Vi still does her job plenty well and in an at least acceptably healthy fashion. Vi can be made to have her own niche with number changes and a minor rework at most. I'd say focusing Vi more around what she currently has Camille beat with (Crowd Control) would be a good idea.
